meanings.definition: Snapweeds: a plant of the genus Rhinanthus, having square stems and yellow flowers.
meanings.sent1: The snapweeds in the garden bloomed beautifully this spring.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to remove the snapweeds to allow other plants to grow.
meanings.sent3: The snapweeds seemed to dance in the breeze, showing off their yellow flowers.
meanings.sent4: The snapweeds stood tall like little suns in the field.
meanings.sent5: The snapweeds added a splash of color to the otherwise green landscape.

meanings.definition: Snapweeds: a plant that grows rapidly and spreads easily, often considered a weed.
meanings.sent1: The snapweeds took over the garden in no time.
meanings.sent2: It's challenging to control the spread of snapweeds in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The snapweeds played a game of 'who can grow the fastest' with the other plants.
meanings.sent4: The snapweeds were like enthusiastic runners in a race to cover the ground.
meanings.sent5: The snapweeds seemed to have a secret mission to conquer every inch of soil.

meanings.definition: Snapweeds: to quickly and sharply break or make a cracking sound.
meanings.sent1: I heard the branch snapweeds as I stepped on it.
meanings.sent2: The old door handle snapweeds when I turned it.
meanings.sent3: The cookies were so crunchy they snapweeds with every bite.
meanings.sent4: His patience finally snapweeds after waiting for hours.
meanings.sent5: The ice snapweeds under my weight as I walked across the frozen pond.
